page.title: 17Changes in Denbigh area
page.content: This block contains several country houses once occupied by the gentry.{ {Trefeirian}is now a licenced club, its members being employees at the N.Wales Hospital;{Gwynfryn}has been adapted as a unit for patients;{Wynne's Park}has become a nursing/residential home for the elderly;{Brondyffryn Hall}is a Special school for autistic children. The Ystrad river once powered the corn mills at{Segrwyd}and{Brookhouse.} The former is now a private residence and the latter a licensed restaurant. Substantial areas of farm land adjacent to Lon Llewelyn have been developed for municipal and private housing. Animals once driven on foot to and from Smithfield are now carried in livestock lorries. Forms of transport once dependent on horse- power have been replaced by motor vehicles so garages have been erected.
